result.execSummary:
The defendant Trudy A. Baxter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution shall be paid at the rate of $150.00 a month beginning September 27, 2016.
Costs shall be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning October 27, 2016.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trudy A. Baxter

defendant.name: Baxter, Trudy A.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

Defendant Trudy A. Baxter in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of guilty.    Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; restitution in the amount of $900.00 plus 10% surcharge to be paid at the rate of $150.00 a month towards restitution and $25.00 a month toward costs.  $150.00 due today and $175.00 beginning October 27, 2016.  - rt
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 27, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 14, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Trudy A. Baxter in court.  Court advised DE of right to attorney and notice given to DE.  Court enters a plea of not guilty on defendant's behalf. PTC scheduled for August 26, 2016 at 10:00 a.m..  Court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 with standard conditions and to not enter the Medford Walmart.  No objection by defendant. ba

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall not enter the Medford Walmart.
